title: Calories in 100 Grams of Potatoes
meta_description: Discover calories in 100 grams of potatoes, including carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Boiled potatoes, peeled, no added salt, butter, or oil; medium-sized russet variety.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato type, cooking method, skin inclusion, and additions like butter; check labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 grams of boiled potatoes provide ~87 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Mashed with milk (1 tbsp per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 grams of boiled potatoes?
faqs.a: Approximately 87 kcal for boiled, peeled potatoes.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 100 grams of potatoes?
faqs.a: About 20 g carbs, including 1.8 g fiber.

faqs.q: Do potatoes have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Roughly 1.9 g protein and 0.1 g fat per 100 g.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in potatoes?
faqs.a: Boiling keeps calories low (~87 kcal/100 g); frying or adding oil/butter increases them significantly.

faqs.q: Are sweet potatoes different from regular potatoes?
faqs.a: Yes, 100 g sweet potatoes have ~86 kcal but more fiber (3 g) and vitamin A.
